article_title: Judge Paul Friedman's Opinion In Halbig v. Sebelius, Part I

article_metadata.author: Michael F. Cannon

og.description: When a state elects not to establish an Exchange, Judge Friedman says, the ACA directs the IRS to pretend that something clearly false – “Texas has established an Exchange” – is true. Yet he identifies absolutely no statutory provision wherein Congress gives the IRS the permission to act as though obviously untrue things are true.
og.title: ObamaCare Through The Looking Glass: Judge Paul Friedman's Opinion In Halbig v. Sebelius, Part I
